leaflet.constituency: Bury St Edmunds, Stowmarket, Needham Market, and connecting villages

messages.title: Championing our local communities
messages.content: I want to ensure our communities are heard at both a local and national level, receiving the care and attention they deserve. That is why, last summer, I held pop-up surgeries across 44 of the constituency’s towns and villages, meeting residents and pursuing issues including school transportation and environmental protection. Our communities should expect quality services and, working on behalf of residents, I want to see this guaranteed. Already, I have taken up issues concerning mobile masts in Stowmarket and securing vital bus services around Bury St Edmunds.

messages.title: Demanding more rural connectivity
messages.content: Broadband should be the ‘fourth utility’ in our homes. Already I have worked hard to identify ‘hot spot’ areas whilst liaising with BT to deliver connectivity to disconnected residents. Holding meetings exploring innovative solutions; 100% coverage is only possible with strong local leaders.

messages.title: Driving forward roads and rail
messages.content: Since 2015, I have fought for and secured £1.4bn of Eastern rail investment, delivering improvements for rail passengers; including greater frequency, capacity and Wi-Fi. Now, my aim is to ensure our local train stations are similarly, fit for purpose. As Chair of the ‘No More A14 Delays’ campaign I want our Suffolk roads safer, smarter, and less congested, allowing our towns to thrive and grow. Securing this and key investment can only be done by making Suffolk a dynamic case for Bury St Edmunds and Suffolk.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring communities receive attention at local and national levels through surgeries and addressing issues like school transportation and environmental protection.
Working to identify broadband ‘hot spot’ areas and liaising with BT to improve connectivity for disconnected residents.
Secured £1.4bn for Eastern rail investment and promoting safer, smarter roads through the ‘No More A14 Delays’ campaign.
